Line 8: Line 8:
On October 13, about 150 people convened a General Assembly and voted to begin an occupation in the city's Central Park. Unlike Occupy Wall Street's occupation of Zucotti park, however, Occupy Davis did not set up semi-permanent encampments. Instead, protestors organized to maintain a constant presence in the park, 24 hours a day, along with erecting a symbolic tent. <ref>[http://www.davisenterprise.com/local-news/occupy-davis-chooses-central-park-as-its-focus/ Occupy Davis chooses Central Park as its focus] </ref>
On October 13, about 150 people convened a General Assembly and voted to begin an occupation in the city's Central Park. Unlike Occupy Wall Street's occupation of Zucotti park, however, Occupy Davis did not set up semi-permanent encampments. Instead, protestors organized to maintain a constant presence in the park, 24 hours a day, along with erecting a symbolic tent. <ref>[http://www.davisenterprise.com/local-news/occupy-davis-chooses-central-park-as-its-focus/ Occupy Davis chooses Central Park as its focus] </ref>
  +   +
==November 28 General Strike==
  +
On November 21, a General Assembly at UC Davis campus voted (with 99.5% consensus) to stage a General Strike throughout Davis, California on Monday, November 28th.<ref>[http://www.occupyucdavis.org/ "Occupy UC Davis Calls for a General Strike"]</ref>
  +
